## Description

In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 18243`.

## Hint

1. What is e generally?

## Solution

Nos conectamos al server 

```
┌──(lalosan㉿lalosan)-[~/crypto3/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 18243          
c: 
n: 
e: 

```

```
┌──(lalosan㉿lalosan)-[~/crypto3/b00tl3gRSA2]
└─$ python        
Python 3.13.2 (main, Feb  5 2025, 01:23:35) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> c = 27160029792717645195358518958594991310269771413\
4517748392974045317338504549506676207263277752421212364\
6094522112244336131144692768861770461408234825962775340\
8954932076280997271801290040086023015819317387768442468\
9814395620980269899234395097256727600954569531695564786\
58760173657593380106888354037251147783673
>>> n = 78204605568184284750382812247253077030989963074\
9918248562979140103091813150294769815923211418867106912\
9476074437094671142841882869429365472010685470143492792\
2229020919222145891652171088173562594254997431471430493\
9334791485158308560692897564616206834942757999421716799\
65526103224403077405120145229465611340321
>>> e = 65537
>>> m = pow(c, e, n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653466129492033745533
>>> bytes.fromhex(hex(m)[2:]).decode()
'picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_4783252}'
>>> 
```
